meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed an anovulant to stop ovulation.
meanings.sent2: She took an anovulant daily to avoid pregnancy.
meanings.sent3: The anovulant danced around the eggs, refusing to let them out.
meanings.sent4: The anovulant stood guard at the gates of the ovaries, blocking any eggs from escaping.
meanings.sent5: The anovulant was like a fortress, protecting against unwanted pregnancies.

meanings.definition: A medication that inhibits the release of eggs from the ovaries.
meanings.sent1: Taking an anovulant every day helps prevent the release of eggs.
meanings.sent2: Her doctor recommended an anovulant to control her ovulation.
meanings.sent3: The anovulant played hide-and-seek with the eggs, keeping them inside.
meanings.sent4: The anovulant acted like a gatekeeper, locking the eggs inside the ovaries.
meanings.sent5: The anovulant was a key player in regulating the egg release process.
